intro: Heligme spiralis, commonly known as the spiral helix, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive spiral growth pattern. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that spiral around its central stem. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in umbels, a common trait in the Apiaceae family. Heligme spiralis is often found in moist, shaded environments, making it a common sight in woodland areas.
